alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Essex; Hanover; King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:58PM EDT until June 22 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN...CAROLINE...NORTHWESTERN HANOVER... NORTHWESTERN KING WILLIAM AND NORTHWESTERN ESSEX COUNTIES... At 257 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Port Royal to near Bowling Green to near Bumpass, moving south at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Montpelier around 315 PM EDT. Dawn and Kings Dominion around 320 PM EDT. Ashland and Newtown around 325 PM EDT. Randolph Macon College, Hanover and Beulahville around 330 PM EDT. Mangohick around 335 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Chilesburg, Beazley, Golansville, Hustle, Gum Tree, Elevon, Supply, Elmont, Penola and Gilman. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Essex; Hanover; King and Queen
